Hammer Museum

Stay in the know with emails from the Hammer.

Sign Up

The Hammer Museum at UCLA believes in the promise of art and ideas to illuminate our lives and build a more just world.

On View

Five Centuries of Works on Paper: The Grunwald Center at 70

  • Dec 20, 2025 – May 17, 2026
This exhibition marks the 70th anniversary of the Grunwald Center, celebrating its history through a selection of significant works that reflect the collection’s breadth and diversity.

Made in L.A. 2025

  • Oct 5, 2025 – Mar 1, 2026
The seventh iteration of the Hammer’s biennial exhibition highlighting the practices of artists working throughout the greater Los Angeles area.

Armand Hammer Collection

This impressive collection of European and American paintings and drawings reflects the interests and passion of the museum’s founder, Armand Hammer.

Alake Shilling: Buggy Bear Crashes Made in L.A.

  • Oct 5, 2025 – Mar 1, 2026
Shilling’s monumental inflatable depicts one of her signature characters—a stern-eyed bear in a hot-pink convertible—atop a colossal strawberry-studded shaped hilltop with daisies.

Upcoming Programs

Screenings

The Story of a Small Town

  • Friday Jan 16, 2026 7:30 PM
A man recently released from prison falls in love with a mute woman in this Taiwanese film, whose theme song “Small Town Story” became one of the first major pop hits to enter Mainland China after its 1978 economic opening.
Special Programs

Will Rawls: Unmade

Saturday Jan 17, 2026 12-4 PM
Made in L.A. artist Will Rawls performs in the Hammer's courtyard and gallery spaces, reflecting on notions of resource-sharing and social choreography.
Kids

Art Lab

Saturday Jan 17, 2026 1–4 PM
Drop by Art Lab for hands-on creative activities inspired by artworks on view at the museum.

Watch on Hammer Channel

Film & TV

Zoey Deutch on "Nouvelle Vague"

December 2025

Actress Zoey Deutch discusses her role in Richard Linklater's tribute to a film that shook the world like few others and sparked an aesthetic revolution that still fascinates audiences: Jean-Luc Godard’s À bout de souffle 
Film & TV

Actors Delroy Lindo & Wunmi Mosaku on "Sinners"

December 2025

Actors Delroy Lindo and Wunmi Mosaku discuss their film Sinners, directed by Ryan Coogler, in a conversation moderated by Jacqueline Coley, journalist and awards editor at Rotten Tomatoes. 
TUNE IN

Hammer Channel

Watch 1,000+ talks, performances, artist profiles, and more. Search, clip, and share topics ranging from politics and activism to art, film, and literature.

Hammer Store

Books and products that celebrate fine artistry, excellent design, and exceptional craftsmanship.

Restaurant

Lulu is the Hammer's new restaurant from David Tanis and Alice Waters.
